name: Christchurch Harbour Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly we didn't have the stay we were expecting. Our room was very small and the view ....... was a brick wall covering the whole window! The interior is however, stunning and very modern.
reviews.title: REALLY disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were considering leaving and not staying until we looked at the spa. It was amazing so decided to return that evening and enjoy it after the screaming children had left. We checked the time with the spa reception and was told as long as we were out by 9 it didn't matter what time we went in. Unfortunatly this was incorrect information and we were told we were 5 minutes too late to entre. However we were allowed in but the cleaners had obviously started their work although we still had 40 minutes till closing. We enjoyed the spa and went back to the changing room. As I started to dry, I could smell a clean chemical smell. Then as I was dressing I found it hard to breathe and ran from the room as my eyes started to smart. As I left I notice some chemicals on the floor along with a face mask!!!!!!
reviews.title: Amazing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great to know hat the place was in tip top clean condition, but please wait for your guests to leave before cleaning with such strong smelling chemicals!
reviews.title: Trust your young staff

reviews.text: Breakfast was cold, very very slow and wrong. Talking to another couple who had stayed for a number of nights they told us they had not had a right breakfast yet! The staff were polite but slapdash nearly spilling my partners food into his lap.
reviews.title: Lovely Location, Good restaurant
Fabulous place
reviews.text: To be honest I wish we had gone with our gut feeling and checked out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decided on a Sat night dinner / bed & breakfast package a treat for the wife's birthday, having read the reviews hotel sounded ideal especially with the spa facilities. Decided not to opt for the winter spa package as the figures didn't really stack up towards any significant savings, decided to book a better room (Gold bedroom with garden views) and take a chance and book spa treatments separately a gamble which in the end didn't pay off as left it until 5 days before to book treatments but no availability, bit of a school boy error!
reviews.title: Stunning location....Lovely Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking as per the reviews is somewhat limited, we arrived, double parked up and let the valet who was ready and waiting park the car elsewhere. Fortunately we did not need the car the rest of the break but I could envisage it's probably a bit of nightmare should you want to go out visiting the sites to keep getting your car retrieved. Welcome from reception stuff was warm, declined the use of the porter service to help with luggage, offer nice all the same and as I would have expected for where this hotel is pitching itself.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was in the newer part of the building, modern and plush, if not a little on the small side. Was nice to have the patio doors to look out onto the partial views of the harbour and across the grounds to the jetty restaurant, would have been nice to actually have had our own patio & furniture to sit on also, it was more of a path connecting all rooms as opposed to full on patio. Not sure if in the summer months furniture would have been available. Rooms very clean and fixtures and fittings of a high standard (still didn't managed to suss out the touch button light switches in the 24hrs we were there, drove the wife mad just trying to switch bed side lamp off!!) One thing which room was missing and I think others have commented on was the lack of aircon. Room was very warm so again patio doors were very welcome and had a safety lock which fortunately allowed us to sleep with the doors ajar but still secure, otherwise we would have boiled in there all night!
reviews.title: Very nice 2 night break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner package was good, allowance was plenty with only minimal supplements if desired. Staff were friendly but not particularly attentive which we were fine with, probably more disappointed at the speed between all the courses, think we were done and dusted within less than an hour which again would have been fine if the the restaurant had been a bit more intimate. Tables were very close together and the room was brightly lit so not much of an ambience which was a shame because the lounge / bar area was not that big so it was a little tight on seating, we had to share a table for our pre dinner drinks but managed to bag a couple of chairs in the corner for some drinks after dinner which was nice.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took full advantage of the spa facilities for is one of the main things we look for in a night away.
reviews.title: Fantastic luxury hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as a couple on the recommendation of a friend whose husband has business connections in the area and for whom this is a preferred hotel. So let me start with the positives;
reviews.title: Didn't live up to expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel enjoys a lovely situation right on the Mudeford Estuary, lovely view and great outdoor space on the terrace from which to enjoy it. The hotel itself is very well appointed both in terms of rooms and public spaces. All the necessary amenities are they and they are done well. There is a spa which I didn’t use but which seemed well patronised and busy.
reviews.title: A good hotel that lets itself down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now we move onto the negatives which for us outweighed the positives. We found the service very disappointing and the staff although pleasant enough in the main didn’t follow through on any request until it had been made twice. The phone at Reception and Room Service rang out for some minutes at a time without being answered. Only the girls cleaning the rooms responded well to a request for additional tea and coffee and it was with me in seconds. Other requested items such as an iron took three asks to appear (despite the literature saying there was one in the room)
reviews.title: A great spa package at a friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, our main gripe was with the restaurant, despite wandering in at 7.30 and being only two persons we could not be accommodated. Being resident we were astounded by this, but we were not being singled out, we witnessed another couple being turned away also. It seemed ridiculous to us that so early in the season we could not get a table for two at the hotel restaurant. The Maître D was blasé and disinterested, we felt he could have found us a table had he wished but it was simply too much trouble. Breakfast service was either slow or rushed, on our first morning we had not actually taken our seats before being asked for our order, we had not had a menu but the girl had her pen poised, the second day tea and coffee took 20 mins to arrive. The food was fine, but nothing special.
reviews.title: Just awful!

reviews.text: There were several other issues too; complete absence of mobile phone signal in the rooms and in the public rooms meant that most of the guests were on the car park trying to get a signal. Lack of adequate car parking spaces for a hotel of that size mean that what space there is is quickly filled up and the hunt for a space is on. Some of the rooms are very overlooked by the apartment block next door which means that you cannot have the shutters open too far as those who are on the balconies can see right in. On checkout there was only one Receptionist on duty and we waited in line, we were unfortunate to be behind two couples whose bills were incorrect and as no one else came to attend to other customers we waited a considerable time.
reviews.title: Lovely furnishings - terrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not one for pro-actively writing reviews, but we were so impressed with our stay at the Christchurch Harbour Hotel I thought I would! We booked a Sunday night spa break with dinner which was excellent value for money. The hotel is in a lovely location, very clean and well furnished. I'd emailed ahead to ask for a room upgrade for our wedding anniversary; this wasn't possible but there were some lovely chocolates and a card waiting there for us.
reviews.title: We'd definitely go again!

reviews.text: All in all, we thought the spa facilities were excellent, although a little small if it got busy. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, and the food was excellent quality and sensibly priced (for a hotel). Breakfast was also superb! The spa treatments we had were also excellent, although the therapists did talk a little too much when trying to relax :). We'd definitely go back and would recommend to friends.
reviews.title: Amazing wedding venue!
Comfortable base, but...
reviews.text: We got married at the Christchurch Harbour Hotel just over two weeks ago and had a really amazing day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful in the lead-up to the wedding and were able to accommodate all of our needs within our wedding package.
reviews.title: "Not a relaxing stay"
Spa day
reviews.text: On the day of the wedding, the team worked tirelessly to ensure everything ran like clockwork. We also had a toastmaster as part of our package, which also ensured everything ran smoothly and totally took the pressure off of us. After so much planning, we didn't have to worry about a thing on the day.

description: Luxury Spa Hotel in Christchurch, Dorset. Waking up to incredible views over to the harbour, enjoying a bracing walk across to Hengistbury Head, or hiding away with a holistic treatment at the luxurious Harbour Spa - this is all possible at Christchurch Harbour Hotel & Spa. Make the most of this unique location whatever the season – a change of scenery, warm and attentive hospitality, delicious food, which reflects the very best local produce, and a chance to breathe in the fresh sea air. The Harbour Restaurant serves exceptional flavours from the landscape and waters of Dorset and a few steps across the lawn, literally perched on the water’s edge, is our award-winning restaurant The Jetty. From foraging in the New Forest, to the best local catch, expect wonderful seasonal ingredients and flavours. And as Dorset wedding venues go, the Christchurch Harbour is a home-from-home on your wedding day, in absolute luxury and in extra special surroundings.
